name: John Whitlock
text: Had Mama's pancake breakfast.  As always it was delicious. Never gotten a bad meal here.

name: Dianne Mitchell
text: The food is good. If you are dining in the customer service is great.  Ordering takeout is a nightmare though.  Even after you call your order in you still have to wait a long time before it's ready when you arrive at the restaurant to pick it up.  Sometimes I have waited 30 minutes or more to bring my food I ordered over the phone and the place was not busy.

name: lawrence Hart
text: The chain itself just isnt as good as it used to be.

name: Kristi Spears
text: Love this place

name: ML Howell
text: Sometimes there is no love in the food. It's not as good as it used to be.

name: Robin Featherston
text: I had the turkey dinner special, it was SO good. My waitress was really nice.

name: Chris Melton
text: Great food good time with our family. It's a real treat to get to spend this time with our grandparents. Life is short an time is a theif an a place like this is the best place to make these memories. So thank you Cracker barrel.

name: Charles Swindle
text: Got chicken livers great. Hot cornbread on  cold day hot the spot

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Food was terrible. Tested as if the largest portion of my meal came from a tin can. There was NOTHING fresh. Service was decent but the restaurant was a bit unkempt.  The floors were in desperate need of a good cleaning.  The bathroom was in deplorable condition. Paper everywhere,  garbage cans in need of attention and the smell..ugh! The cost was over priced for what turned out to be a disappointment in dining. The lot and grounds were less than inviting and in need of attention. I will not be returning and would never recommend this establishment to friends unless I wanted to punish them.

name: Stephanie G
text: Ordered to go online. Waited 15 minutes for order that should have been waiting for me. Food is always good but I ordered early so it would be ready. Would have canceled order but they take your money before I knew it wasn't ready. They won't get me again!

name: Robert Smith
text: Half of food was cold

name: David Knuckle
text: Ignored at the reception desk. She walked past and said be right with you.  Started to adjust displays right in front of us! I guess we didn't look like her type of people. So rude. We walked out. Won't go back

name: Patsy Logan
text: It was okay because of the food although my chicken was a little over cooked, not juicy inside as usual. Cracker Barrel can't hardly be outdone, but today wasn't the best. The service was a server that hasn't been trained or does not listen. He would stand on one side of the table and hand the food/drinks to me across the front of  people sitting beside me. NOT COOL.  The cashier ask if everything was ok and I told her except for the waiter. She didn't ask why or anything...

name: Jonathon Crosby
text: Good country food good service

name: Debra Lyn Denison
text: Delicious food no matter what you order! The Mac and cheese is the best in world according to my daughter

name: Beverly Peters
text: Wonderful meal and service!

name: Melissa Thorn
text: Great food. Great service.  Good prices

name: Jennifer Silcox
text: Loren was the sweetest server. She was very polite and attentive. Our family always enjoys Cracker Barrel's food and now Loren has set the bar for service! Thank you!

name: Jeff Burnett
text: Very good service and food

name: Subastjion Ritter
text: Took my two little ones there for Valentine's Day breakfast / dinner. The food was excellent and even though they were busy, the wait wasn't too bad. The waitress was extremely nice, and she said she was new. However, everything was perfect.

name: Marie Flannagin
text: I love Cracker Barrel.

name: Pedro Garcia
text: Good service good food

name: Kitty Cat
text: Staff is amazing. And they have excellent food. And a fantastic gift shop.

name: Susan Hamm
text: Cracker Barrel is a pleasant lovely place to enjoy your meal. The service and food was excellent. Our waitress was a very caring sweet lady and we had a terrific time. Well worth visiting again. Again the food was so so delicious.

name: Guy Holmes
text: Good service. Ordered the egg sandwich which was very good. Love their sweet tea.

name: Barb Kirtman
text: Tried several locations, just not a fan. Coffee is fresh, but weak and tasteless. Eggs good, but sausage patty dry and tough to chew. Won't be trying again.

name: Boyce Q “Austin T” Kennedy III
text: The staff at this Cracker Barrel is extraordinarily nice, friendly, and quick to return with your food. I always enjoyed going there when I’m visiting my dad.

name: Charles Gray
text: Service was slow tonight. Had to ask different waitress for a refill of tea. Food was great as always. We have visited thos Cracker Barrel several times and we have never had bad service until tonight. This low rating has nothing to do with the restaurant. It is clean, friendly staff and great food as always, serves breakfast all day too. Waitress gets 3 stars and that's being gracious. Restaurant gets 5 stars.

name: Michael Gross
text:
If you don't mind incompetence in a establishment this is the place for you.  Sorry but all wow is all i can say about this cracker barrel experience.  It started with the hostess, we checked in and was told about a 30 min wait because we had a party of 6.  When i checked back with them 30 mins later i saw our name had a table number 157 attached to our name and was told by the hostess that they were waiting on another table and it would another 10 mins.  After that 10 mins was up, i checked back in with the hostess and noticed the number changed to 214 and the hostess mentioned another 10 mins as they are still waiting for a table to open up.  In the mean time, 10 sets of 2 and 2 sets of 3 were seated while my party waited for this mysterious table to open up.

Secondly, if you have three cash registers open and only one seems to be working on cashing out customers, something is wrong.  I have family now living in Florence but will wait a long time before attempting to eat at this establishment again.

name: Larry Melton
text: The food and service was excellent, but, when paying the cashier said tap green button once for tip, tap green button 2 times for no tip. The tip was left on table, and the recipe folded nicely in half with tip added in. The trans. Was redone. Just check recipt.

name: Marla Baker
text: Bad service

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Marla. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please use your review username as your subject line, and include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any additional information you’d like to share with us.

name: snew
text: One of my favorite cracker barrels!  Everyone is great and food is always good! Feels like family when there, so many of the crew knows us by name. I take my mother every weekend when I'm up from Cullman.

name: Sandra Eddins
text: There was a huge line when we got there, but we were seated immediately.  Our server was perfect. No empty glasses, which we usually keep them busy with refills. Food was great. I always get the cracker barrel sampler at dinnertime.

name: dena king
text: The food was cooked perfectly our waittres was very nice and fast

name: Mark Parker
text: Great food. Service was a mite slow for the low number of customers. The banana pudding is awesome.

name: cory buffaloe
text: I love Cracker Barrel. You can't go wrong with this place. From pancakes to the dinners, everything is good.

name: Jeremy Wise
text: Service was good. Was out of chicken fried steak. I was disappointed

name: Alabama Gemstones
text: Hot, fresh breakfast

name: curious creations
text: Awesome service!  Food was very good!  Thank you for a good experience!

name: Dawn Buttrum
text: All was good except the sausage patties were not cooked inside.

name: Perry Mcarthur
text: Menu needs improvement and somebody needs to teach the cooks how to properly make a BLT . last time i got BLT they buttered N grilled the bread ao much the butter literally was dripping off the bread. Could not even eat after the first bite.

name: Devon Henley
text: Speedy service even with a packed house

name: Harry D Smith
text: I love the oatmeal breakfast.  Top it off with a bottomless cup of coffee and you have a great meal.

name: TheDetroDiesel
text: Country fixins cooked to perfection and a down home staff and atmosphere

name: Nina Coats
text: Food was great

name: Gene Gresham
text: Cracker barrel is a good family restaurant where you can get together with family and friends. They have good home cooked food and a friendly atmosphere. Check it out if you haven't already.

name: Amy McArthur
text: The store was just as I remembered. The food was delivered, fast, hot, and delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

name: Tony Allen
text: Love there and they are very friendly.

name: Taryn Doxie
text: Very, very good food and service. Didn’t have to wait long either !!

name: Charles Swindle
text: Went there tonight Will was our server and never missed a beat. He was great. The catfish was fried very well cooked. Cornbread was very good. We will be back and hopefully get Will again.

name: oompa “oompf” looompa
text: Great, cozy and welcoming place. Fast service and amazing hospitality.

name: Dean Jackson
text: Picked up two meals and while we really like CB my serving of carrots netted six pieces while my wife's order had 12 or so.  They also didn't put our bread in the bag; not good.  But the food was great.

name: Mary Hughes
text: Very disappointed this time food was cold & bland cornmuffins were so hard had to ask for fresher ones grilled pork chop was tuff & had no flavor at all , dressing had a lil to much sage, overall not a good dinner

name: Beverly Emerson
text: Had to wait over an hour

name: Brittany Wood (bwooderp)
text: Service was fast considering how packed the parking lot was. However, the food was less than satisfactory. I ordered the French toast with strawberries; the French toast seemed to be only toasted bread and the bottled syrup was the only source of flavor. The strawberries were not fresh but were frozen, however I saw at another table that someone received pancakes with strawberries that were clearly fresh. My grandmother ordered gravy and was dissatisfied with its taste. We have decided we will most likely never eat at Cracker Barrel again as the food is just not the same quality anymore.

name: Lisa Wood
text: Great place and the most helpful people! I ordered a meal for my family and it was awesome!My grandma who is now 90 and not able to cook anymore loved it. The whole family did. I will definately do this again.

name: Cindy Prince
text: The food wasn't very good. Also it was served almost cold.We were expecting so much more but just didn't deliver .I don't know what all the hype is about.

name: Nathaniel Whitaker
text: Very busy but our waitress was wonderful. She took great care of us and was so kind. She even brought my six year old daughter a free hot chocolate that just made her night!

name: Katie Hardy
text: Best customer service ever! All of the servers are very attentive and polite. The food is amazing. I always get breakfast. Their coffees are amazing and if they still have the beignets try them! They are perfect!

name: Craig Casiday
text:
The host somehow lost us off of the wait list.  After 45 minutes of waiting they had seated everyone but us.
When the second host offered to take out name and we told her that we should have been on the list already because we had been waiting for 45 minutes she said, "you should have...".
When we spoke with the manager she told us "some parties of two didn't show when they were called."

Dinner was good, our service was good, and they did give us free dessert.    My real problem with this experience is that they tried to share the blame with us for their mistake.

name: Rachel Purser
text: Our waitress was probably the best one we have ever had in a long time. Very friendly, fast and helpful! Needless to say she got a great tip. Love the New menu to! Good job Florence Cracker Barrel!

name: Dre Taylor
text: Did a pick up order. Foods was great !

name: Savage Ali Zugel (李野蛮)
text:
You know there is a large senior citizen population when you find a Cracker Barrel THIS far from an interstate. God bless them. Cracker Barrel is delicious.

We went in on memorial day evening. Joshua was our server and was excellent. He was the nicest, sincere, and attentive server I've had at any eatery since moving to Alabama last spring. Thanks again, Sir!

A warning if you aren't familiar with CB or southern food: when ordering the vegetarian dinner, be sure to specify that you dont want any bacon in each item in which you're ordering. Seriously...

name: Margie Wright
text: I think I could stay all day looking around.they have the prettiest things. If I did stay I could have all three meals of the day and I mean good meal.

name: chay welsh
text: My daughter and I were in a hurry. So we decided to just get takeout so I went inside it took about 15 minutes to get a waitress just the ticket take out order and I said to her I have to run and go get something next door she said it will just be one minute I said should I wait or can I go she said no go it'll be ready when you get back I was gone for about 15 minutes expecting them to be ready when I got back and she hadn't even put the order in. I will never get take out there again they did compensate my order which I do appreciate but I will not go back again.

name: Davis Custom -Lyndsey Davis
text: The store selection is great and the food is even better. We never mind a wait to eat here and the coffee and mocha drinks are amazing.

name: Jennie Linn Medders (Lucy)
text: Cracker Barrel is always great and the food is always served piping hot  !!! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: Jim Byrum
text: Always great food n friendly service n a clean resttuant

name: kalyn montague
text: Great food and the company was even better. Excellent service and the price was reasonable.

name: KAY FOWLER
text: Food was good service was good too and they have a nice gift shop.

name: River Lafloor
text: All around goods place to eat

name: Jason Azbell
text: Food and service was great.

name: Vickie Clemmons
text: Shari was a great server! Very good Friday fish meal.

name: Jamie Statom
text: Get the strawberry lemonade. No, seriously, get it. My waitress brought two glasses to start because she knew I would drink both. And I did. And a third. ~ Seriously~, get the strawberry lemonade.

name: John Acker
text: Food is always good plus great service

name: Megan Hollander
text: I alwyas have a great experience here. Their food is amazing and always hot. They keep my coffee cup full and make sure I have enough cream :)

name: Patty Beavers
text: Great food & service

name: Carol Tate
text: Love eating here. Great food

name: Chase McClure
text: Friendly customer service

name: RW W
text: They need to bring back the chicken fried chicken ! Otherwise everything is good.

name: Ro bn Barb
text: Very good and not high

name: Daniel Surber
text: Great food and service

name: Cecil Staggs
text: Food was cooked perfect! Our waitress was amazing we never had to ask for anything!  Great experience! Definitely will return

name: Lewis Masterson
text: Was great food and service. The only problem I had is at the busy time you don't have room in the store because it is crowded. I am in a wheelchair an that made it so much harder on me you either need to add on or take some supplies out.

name: Jesyka Davis (Jess)
text: Our server and hostess was friendly. Great food for a good price.

name: Ben Pennington
text: It's hard to beat a Cracker Barrel and this one was no exception.  Everything we had for breakfast was good and hot as you would expect.  I do miss their red eye gravy which was discontinued by the corporate office.  Big mistake IMHO.

name: Kurt Hanke
text:
The food and the service were both good.

Also, it's always fun browsing through their store before sitting down for dinner.

name: Virginia Lamy
text: Food good. Servers very polite. They take care of their customers.

name: Jessica Riley
text: I was one of 2 people picking up a togo order and the parking spaces set for us were already taken so obviously the signs don't work. I got there 20 minutes after my estimated pickup time and still had to wait 10 more minutes for them to bring it out. They left out my okra and when she went to get it I was told it would be a 3 minute wait for it to cook. I asked the cashier who rang me up to add some extra biscuits, maple syrup, and honey mustard because when you order online they don't give you the option to ask for these things. I heard her tell someone through the headset she was wearing. They left off my honey mustard and also didn't give me any plastic ware or the extra napkins I had added to my online order. They were kind of busy but like i said i waited 20 minutes after the time they told me to be there and still had to wait longer and not get everything i asked for. It's just annoying to be honest.

name: Janet Boatright
text: Great place to eat and good place to work . Have meet  a lot of great people working there.

name: A W
text: Love the chicken and dumplings, but my local CB gives bigger helpings.

name: Lydia Drueke Gipson
text: It is surprising how many places to not know how to cook fried eggs over medium. I have never had a problem at this Cracker Barrel. The dinning room and clean and the music is not to loud. We have always gotten good service.

name: Kathryn Schram Findlay
text: Wooden chairs are very uncomfortable... Need cushions. Floors sticky, sticky stuff on bottoms of my shoes. Our server Kristan was very good‼️Had breakfast, very good! ☕🍳🥘🥞

name: Mary Ivy
text: One of our favorite Places To eat

name: Latricia Hensley
text: Love to shop while waiting. Food was good and staff was friendly. The wait was long but it went fast while looking around.

name: Darlene McDonald
text: Great food & selections. Very friendly staff. Great place to shop also in the country store.

name: MiFamilia Wolfe
text: It was our very first time and we can now see why it's so popular! Food was great and seemed freshly prepared. Not expensive, very fairly priced. I highly suggest the beneighs.

name: Jackie Hughes
text: Love cracker barrel. Always a fun time especially with kiddos in the store.

name: lisag williams
text: Hashbrown casserole is all you really need to know....and get the burger.

name: Steve Tidwell
text: Country Boy Breakfast, side of 3 pancakes, with milk, coffee, orange juice,  cold ice water!

name: Teresa Stitzel
text: Real friendly, good food, big portions

name: Sheila Roberson
text: It is a very clean family orientated restaurant.The Food was delicious and the service was great.

name: Edith Marie Gray
text: Just yum!

name: Susan Jones
text: Fantastic!

name: Tony Trousdale
text: Worst experience I ever had at a restaurant. People seated in front of us ordered and finished eating and we were still waiting.  The hostess got us water and coffee and kept checking on us.  Our waiter was the worst.  We finally after 30 minutes of waiting got up and left and ate at Bojangles across the road

name: Julia Welborn
text: Food was very tasty, but way to cold. I had to send it back. It wasn't room temperature.  This has happened before.  I really do like cracker barrel. But I need my food hot.

name: Rodney Cotten
text: Good food

name: Erika Byers
text: Absolutely amazing service! Everyone was extremely friendly! Food was wonderful as well.

name: Patti Smith
text: The food was good southern food and had a general store and very good service.

name: Cliff Richey
text: It is always great food and family atmosphere, always see good friends that I haven't seen in a while.

name: Get Brad
text: Excellent place to have breakfast, lunch or even dinner. Great family atmosphere, and great tasting food served in a timely manner.

name: Philip Posey
text: We had a great meal and wonderful service! They are always busy at this location but take time to treat you like family.

name: Sam Murphy
text: This place is brand new and is not settled in yet. It's always crowded and I have a tough time dealing with it in my opinion. I ordered a simple meal eggs bacon and toast took them over half an hour to get it out to me. I was ready to leave. They will do better after they've been open for a while

name: Shoals Yakkin' with Hatch
text: Always good for a home cooked style meal. Unusually there was no wait at all. They always make it worth the wait when there is one though.

name: Aaron Alexander
text: Great food.  Great atmosphere!! Wonderful place.

name: Jarl Balgruuf
text: Cracker Barrel is awesome.  You can get flipping pancakes any time you want, I mean that's about enough for 5 stars in itself.  Great food at good prices mean it's hard to go wrong here.  The staff is sometimes a bit distracted/inattentive but as long as you're not willing to flag them down and ask for refills/jelly/whatever you need it's not a big deal.  They're generally friendly and keep the place clean.  It's fairly quiet most of the time (at least for dinner) so it's a good place to chat with family or friends while you eat.  That old country feel and the accompanying country-style menu give this place a unique rustic feel that not many other restaurants offer.

name: Paul Terry
text: The waitress we had can't Remember her name? She a great waitress.

name: Dennis Phillips
text: Not sure if they have changed their sausage but it seemed thinner and tougher than it used to. I asked, but the associate didn't know. The eggs were room temperature, if that. The loaded hashbrown casserole was good though

name: Josh Shouse
text: Great restaurant.  Good down home cooking.  Very friendly and fairly priced.

name: LeChe
text: Food was great as always!! Our waitress was Amazing!!

name: Bradley Mifflin
text: Great home country style like every Cracker Barrel. They have figured this market out and have it cornered. The food is about what you would expect. Nothing fancy, but satisfying.

name: Stephen W.
text: Food and Service were excellent.

name: Angel Cantie
text: Always a good meal!  No worries about feeling ulky after a meal at Cracker Barrell.

name: Sandy Jensen
text: Fast service, fried chicken special was good at a busy time

name: Patsy Smith
text: Good

name: Michael Sturdevant
text: Great people. Great food.

name: Patricia Hill
text: Fresh food and great service

name: Victoria Vanvoltenburg
text: Everyone was very nice and the food was amazing. I love it so much and so does my whole family

name: Lucinda Frost
text:
Today's meal wasn't great. I placed my ordered (4 plates) waited then after a little while, waitress came out and said I'm sorry they are out of cornbread dressing. The only reason I came today on Monday was for the dressing for my son. Lady said everything else was done.
Then when we got home to eat later on, the mashed potatoes were hard. My son wasn't happy with dumplings from here.
It will be awhile before we go back

name: Varuniqa Hernandez
text: Boy friend took me here for breakfast and OMG I LOVE IT

name: Gail Lessard
text: Food and service were great!

name: Demetrius “Jim” Boucher
text: Great food. Wonderful service & love the merchandise.

name: Rocky Phillips
text: I've been eating here my whole life and I've never had a bad experience. Great home style cooking for a reasonable price which brings the only drawback of being BUSY ALL THE TIME. I dont think I've ever been here and not had to wait but it has always been worth the wait

name: Donna Cooper
text: Love cracker barrel. Great food and service.

name: Charlene Moultrie
text: Great food and customer service.   Hamilton Place location is wonderful.

name: Morgan Cordle
text: Waitress was rushed. Lunch was okay. Atmosphere was great as always.

name: Kisha Armstead
text: In-house service is fantastic but ordering online is terrible.  I called and the girl hung up while trying to transfer me.  A second attempt only had my order messed up (egg bits instead of scrambed) and I was unable to take back.

name: Little Red
text: Great food and service

name: Joyce Alstadt
text: Slow

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about the slow service, Joyce. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please use your review username as your subject line, and include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any additional information you’d like to share with us.

name: Danielle Richey
text: They have great food and are reasonably priced. They have wonderful employees who are very courteous. You have to wait for your food because they cook it to order. So be prepared.

name: Marty Thomas
text: Not good food at all. Cold and old

name: WILLIAM L. ROTENBERRY
text: Consistent , Country Home Cooked Meals !

name: Tyler Harris
text: Delicious food and good service.

name: johnny appleseed
text: I love cracker barrel and eat at our local one at least once a week. Also while traveling we will stop and spend some time with them. My first major complaint is for some reason they have changed bacon. Terrible now, if it ain't broke don't fix it.

name: Annakah Jones
text:
My server wasn't very helpful and the food wasn't good- undercooked sausage, eggs were rubbery, the pancakes were cold, and the coffee was burnt. The friendliest people seemed to be the ones at the register in the store area who did a very good job managing the stress of the store and up-selling.

Everything was clean and well-kept, but this wasn't a good visit at all.

name: Haley Bugg
text: Cracker barrel never disappoints in my eyes. Consistently great food/service.

name: Jackie Goodman
text: It was very good and the employee are friendly

name: Judy Williams
text: They have delicious food and very friendly people

name: janice osborn
text: I ordered hamburger steak, mashed potatoes, pinto beans, cornbread. Potatoes were cold so I asked for some fresh ones, the waitress brought me a bowl that had been put in the microwave that was steaming hot  🔥 and handed them to me on the tray. I went to pick them up and almost dropped them. Could not even eat them. And I love cracker barrel but that was a bad experience just glad I was not burn from them. Also there was a guy came over to my table said he was the manager in the back he was laughing and said he was sorry and it was his fault.

name: Rachael Dail
text: Basically this is like every other cracker Barrell I've ever visited. This restaurant is very good at maintaining standards no matter which one you visit. Nice and helpful staff.

name: Kevin Taylor
text: Food great as always. Our waitress was subpar to say the least. Service very slow and never got our biscuits we asked for 3 times and just gave up... lol... but the food we got was very good.

name: Jacky Richardson
text:
Service was good and kelp my coffee cup filled
The atmosphere  was very pleasing.

name: Donna Bennett
text: Food was cold.. not good. Service was good.. but that's it. Very disappointed.

name: Sonya Henderson
text: Love the food and atmosphere.

name: Vanessa Brown
text: Who doesn't love a Cracker Barrel?!?!? Great food and shopping all at one location is hard to beat.

name: Linda Johnson
text: I love green beans. Although the chicken n dumplings had an underlying cinnamon taste...must have gotten too close to the apples.

name: Michael E Panigoni
text: Love that I can eat breakfast for dinner!

name: Kim Curtis
text: I called my order in, I arrive at the store 20 min later. After a 55min combined total I ask about my (dipped not cooked) food, the 2 at front just calls says marks still waiting.  OK 15 mins later I ask how long will it be? He says I can't walk back n see, so the girls says say thing again, but yet still does not ask how much longer.  After 1hr 30 for beans dumplings and slaw, I ask for my money back on card. Then food comes around corner.  I get in car get to red light and look in bag, all my food was not there.   I turn around go back and get it..  Not once did a manager take to me or offer apology..  If they had been busy OK but they were not.  I have never had a bad exp6here til today..  So female manager worker 01/03/19 @3 pm you need to train yourself and employees to at least act like they give 2 S....   About customers.  This is unacceptable. If it happens again, I will never return.

name: Shane Haddock
text: Good service, good food and clean. Will be back again

name: TOmmy Elliott
text: Best service ever. Food was great even my grand daughters ate very good. Thanks.

name: Emmanuel Jones
text: Love the down south country food.

name: Arlington Gilbreath
text: Good food, quick service

name: David Pankratz
text: Great food and customer service!!

name: Karen Farmer
text: Good food, nice servers. Don't expect fast delivery of food, but worth the wait.

name: Dublin Burgess
text: Our waitress was excellent and so was our breakfast!

name: rex lewis
text: Good food as always clean friendly service

name: Josi Bee
text: Best breakfast you can get! Had the country fried steak. Friendly and attentive service, food was delicious, atmosphere great as always. Loved it!

name: Susan Hughes
text: Always have a great experience with service and quality food.0

name: A.M. Orr
text: Wonderful food, great staff and a beautiful, clean, family friendly restaurant!  The only negative is that it's always busy and there's usually a wait, but that's because everyone knows how enjoyable it is.

name: Daniel Cobb
text: Good food, good staff

name: Dena Wilson
text: Great food and good service. As is the case anywhere you go, depends on your server to the quality of service. But still a favorite place to eat and shop!

name: Sarajane Stem
text: Great service and a good meal

name: Ernesto Ramos III
text: The wait was to long

name: Sebrina Benson
text: Food was cold,so busy,said something to waitress,didn't do any good won't take my family outta town any more

name: A.H. Wright
text: Service was great as was the food.

name: Kristy Babcock
text: Very good. Delicious American style food and great service.

name: Cameron Moody
text: Staff is amazing, food is fair, speed is horrible! Past two times here one being a Monday other on a Wednesday it took over 1 hr each time...

name: Cindy Watkins Turner
text: Listen my husband and i LOVE this place!

name: DORIS CRITTENDEN
text: So delicious! Service was better than last time.Last time bad experience in waiting for desert for 20 minutes to he told they were out if it.😳I love the Cracker Barrel !

name: Steve Kennedy
text: We ordered fried catfish. It was very good! Great service and very clean!

name: Jennifer Stites
text: My worst Cracker Barrel experience to date. My fiance and I were told "grab a menu and seat yourselves." After five minutes, a waitress finally came by asking if someone had gotten our drink order yet, no one had, she took our drink order. Another waitress brought our drinks and took our order. A third brought our food, which was cold. We were left without refills for the entire meal. I wanted dessert, but none was offered or suggested.  10 minutes after we decided we were done, our check was brought and we were told to have a good night. I have always been a fan of eating at this restaurant, but after rude service, cold food and no refills, we will probably never be back.

name: Brian West
text: What isn't there to love about cracker barrel? They have great service at this location and great tasting well cooked food. I always love shopping for little nicnac gifts in the gift shop after. Some of it its pretty fun to play with, with the family.

name: Mike Herring
text: GOOD place for family to eat, sometimes a short wait very busy. Excellent service!

name: Glenda Brown
text: Good food good service

name: Sierra Lawson
text: Service was great and the food was wonderful today.

name: josh pate
text: Great food and friendly staff me and my family love going here to eat always a great experience

name: Sandra Autry
text: Always good! Had pancakes with peaches for dinner. Yum.

name: Hannah Yoo
text:
The service was nice and waitress was attentive.
What bothered me the most was that they seemed to have salted the ham, making it almost inedible which is hard for me because I'm pretty good at not being picky. Ham is cured with salt and does not need to be sprinkled with more salt when you prepare it for the dish. The smoked sausage had a funny taste and was overly dry, I handed that one over to my boyfriend. Their gravy had a very peculiar sweetness to it, which threw me for a loop.
The pancakes were the saving grace though and the sole reason for giving 3 stars. Delicious! I'll go back for just those, I'll know not to order anything with meat or gravy.

name: Carl Hanback
text: Greatest restaurant for home cooking and homecoming with the Family and Friends. Me my Wife and my Mother visit there often. All of the food is excellent and have a superb gift shop I know you will appreciate.

name: Nicole Littrell
text: Always good!!!

name: Matthew L.
text: Everything you would expect from a Cracker Barrel. This one is well managed and operated. Staff are very friendly. Only downside is the occasional wait, but what can ya do, really?

name: Anonny Moss
text: Always loved Cracker Barrel. Waitresses were fantastic, working with our orders to give us the best price (more bang for our buck).

name: Linda W.
text: The one in Florence when we ate there last Sunday , the food was cold. Coffee took a while to get refills. They must have newer people since the last time we ate there.

name: Celena Tovar
text: Was not the best experience tonight.(9/10/18) Food was brought out in spurts,  salads barely beat the main dish to the table.  There was 8 of us and 5 were served first while the rest waited on ours. Food was cold when brought to table,  I don't know if the server forgot to ring some of our orders in or if it was a kitchen mistake,  but we were not offered an explanation. We eat there a lot but I dont think we will be going back for awhile.  (Not to mention the below temp food could make us sick)

name: Peggy Jones-McCollum
text: Food has no taste. Server was not a good server. Our tea ran out and she only came back to the table once after our order was brought out. We had to ask someone else for tea. She didn't ask if we want any desert.

name: Maria Lepore
text:
Very friendly staff. They had the chimney going on for this bitter cold. (january 18) Good food.
My second visit:
The servers are usually very nice, but today we had an extremely nice server, the best on CB from this location so far. Her name was Ashlynn. Superb customer service. Made our visit a very pleasant one.

name: Jbird bird
text: Service be a little slow.  Food was good

name: Betty Jo
text: Ordered breakfast. All very good.

name: Ashley Graves
text: I love this place great food nice staff but expect to have a wait

name: Pamela Smith
text: Good food

name: Melanie Woods
text: Simply Delicious!

name: Charlotte Johnson
text: I cook all their food at home. So I dont eat hear much only if I'm traveling.

name: Elizabeth B
text: Amazing food. Waitress Erin was very sweet. The coffee was ok I would make the bean roast a bit stronger.

name: James Wallace
text: Great food and friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere

name: TJ
text: We get our orders to go most times when we come here. We usually have big orders and most times at other places something is always left off! But each time we come here they actually HAVE what's on the menu and it's always in our bag when we get home if we ordered it.... That may not seem like a big deal but to people who eat out a lot you'll know things are left off allllll the time! So I appreciate this place a ton! Thanks CB!

name: Blair Jones
text: Love going here for breakfast!! Got to try the hashbrown casserole

name: Chris Hindman
text: Kind people

name: Jeremy Jefferies
text: Great food. Great service.

name: Anna Gibson
text: Great service, great bacon, so I'll be back. But the breakfast sausage wasn't cooked through.

name: Susan Swack
text: My baked potato was brought out 10 mins after they served me my plate I wanted all my food together & portions were very small.

name: Amber McKelvey
text: You can get breakfast or lunch anytime of the day. The pancakes are so delicious!!!!

name: michael holden
text: Always good food with reasonable prices.  Delicious home cooked type meals

name: Aaron Lee
text: Food and service was excellent

name: Della Blankenship
text:
Good
Good
Good

name: Johnny Francis
text: Great food, great shopping experience  !

name: Pamela Thrasher
text: Great service and great food

name: Richard Underwood
text: Hamburger steak had no taste , no seasoning , the last couple of times we have been it hasn't been as good as it used to be , disappointed

name: d smith
text:
I always enjoy going to Cracker Barrel
the service is really good, the food is wonderful, and it doesn't matter if there is just two people or eighty school students , they always accommodate us.

name: Eddie Hampton
text: The food was delicious as usual and our waitress was great. She was really busy in our area but handled everything great with a smile.

name: Rhonda Wilson
text: I love it!! AND the fact that I live about 3 blocks away, when I cook a pot of beans & the fact that I can't cook cornbread!!! I call to order & by the time I get there, I can just walk in & pay for them because they are ALWAYS READY when I get there!! My husband is fine with that but, does want me to learn how to cook cornbread💪❣️lol lol lol

name: Shanna Jean
text:
Enjoy mothers day dinmer here!
Perfecto!

name: Walker Dodson
text: Great experience. I haven't been in a Cracker Barrel that I didn't like. If you are gluten free, they have options for you as well.

name: B E
text: It is an ok place. I prefer breakfast to their other options. I do think service could be better and more efficient.

name: Judy Turbarg
text: Great breakfast plus I love the Shopping Store.

name: Carla King
text: Food was very good this day. I had the sample platter with pinto beans fried oakra and Mac and cheese with corn muffins. Yummy

name: Tim Smith

name: Michael Stewart
text: The service is slow and unwelcoming. The managerial staff doesn't seem to care about the attitude the employees show toward the customers and be prepared for a wait if you want a to go order. Not once, not twice, but the three times we've placed a to go order it has been wrong and twice the wait time they gave when we called the order in. While you're waiting there the employees are rude and do the bare minimum of their job requirements. Also trying to speak to Barron Hamilton is almost impossible because when something is going wrong in the store he always seems to be in a meeting or unable to deal with the problem at hand and don't except for him to call you back either because that won't happen. I feel this is where the problem stems from, bad management!

name: Rachel Harden
text: I had a super great experience with Petries. I decided this year to personalize the gifts to my graduates (which I have not mailed yet - they are coming guys) and they did a super great job!!!  Great color and font selection at a really good cost.  Can't wait to get these in the hands of the graduates this year!  Thanks Petrie's I will not hold the fact that you have no star in the system against you.

name: Kitty Cat
text:
I recently visited here to get my name put on my wallet, it takes up to three days. Everyone here is so nice and friendly, and my wallet turned out so cute!! I've got two purses done here too they all turned out cute!!! I recommed coming here if you want your name on anything vinyl and embroidered.
😻😸

name: Jeanell Wallace
text: Great shopping

name: Stacey Edwards
text:
I went in this morning for the first time in months . No one spoke to me , no one even looked up at me when I was looking at the store.  I had my children with me and when I let my daughter down she ran behind the counter ( she’s 2) . You would think they would have helped or talked to her or dang talked to me but all I got was “ you can come get her “ . One lady never even looked up ! ( she was inches from my daughter ) They acted absolutely ridiculous! They acted as if my children were a huge problem ....if your going to work in a dang children’s boutique act like you at least  like children .. I can assure you of one thing .. I will never walk back in your store and when people ask me where to buy cute bows I will never suggest your store again ! I was so disappointed!

Ohh and I wasn’t the only one they didn’t acknowledge, I never heard them speak to one customer!!

name: SLIM SLIMMI
text: I love the items they sell..very cute..! Very very cute! But me personal feel like the items are over priced..the amount you pay for one bag and to engrave the name..you can buy 3 bags and make your own! Just saying

text: Use to be nice place to shop, but now everything is way over priced from what it used to be. Can find the same stuff they do and sell way cheaper.

name: Jamilah Haseeb
text: Associate at the desk was very helpful...

name: Daphne Ellis-Floyd
text:
My husband and I stopped at Beans on Hand for the first time this morning...then went back later in the day for more! We each tried one of the seasonal specialty coffees and their  breakfast sandwiches are DELICIOUS!

Everyone was friendly and engaging and made us feel right at home. We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you! We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Doug McNutt
text: Fantastic, local coffee shop! Real espresso done right, better than Starbucks. I had a straight black double espresso and it was done very well with nice crema on top. My wife had The Whit which was an excellent flavored drink that she loved. Very nice folks and a nice place to sit to get some work done (they said free WiFi would be available soon).

resp.text: Thank you so much!! I am so happy you were pleased with your visit. We look forward to serving you again soon.

name: C Powell
text: This is an adorable coffee house. Great atmosphere, great service. I really want to give you 5 stars but the fact that no one is wearing a mask is a real disappointment 😔. I would've been a daily regular. The Corona virus is deadly...period.💀 😐. Masks 😷 are effective and an easy way to show you care.

resp.text: Typically we do have them on. For whatever reason we did not. My apologies!

name: Nathan Floyd
text:
AMAZING!! The staff is really friendly and patient.

I had the ham croissant with pepper jack. It was huge, fresh, and amazingly filling. Also, make absolutely sure you try the Vaca! It is life changing!

resp.text: Thanks for coming by.  We look forward to serving you again.

name: Marti Gilley Smith
text: The people were extraordinarily interesting and friendly. The decor was homey and attractive.  The raspberry iced tea was really good.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words! We are glad you enjoyed your experience. We look forward to serving you again!

name: Amber Williams
text: Great coffee, unique flavors such as lavender and rose!!

name: DrDoom Weatherman
text:
Excellent coffeehouse. We travel frequently from the Atlanta area to Foley and wanted to try a local place rather than the McDonald's (which deserves a F by the way stay away from this Mickey Ds).

Highly recommend Beans on Hand...especially their ham and cheese bagel with bacon ranch spread. Ham was thick and the bagel soft and chewy. DELICIOUS!

resp.text: Thank you so much for stopping in! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Brittany Wallace
text: BEANS ON HAND IS A WARM RELAXING ENVIROMENT! LOVE THAT YOU CAN SHOP,EAT, AND GET YOUR COFEE IN ONE TRIP. CARLA ALWAYS GOES ABOVE AND BEYOND TO GIVE YOU WHAT YOU WANT. TACO TUESDAY....NEED I SAY MORE? Never even thought about eating anything but beef on my taco. Tacos with a twist. Go TRY THEM! THEY ARE AWESOME.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words! I am glad we were able to provide you with just what you were looking for! We look forward to serving you again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! It was our pleasure to have you for a visit. Please come again!

text: I've been to the Florence, AL location of Lifeway many, many times and each and every time, the staff greets you as you enter the door.  They have a great inventory of everything and the staff is always standing by to help if you need them.  I would recommend Lifeway to anyone who asks.

name: L johnson
text: I saved almost as much money as I spent. They had accidently scared original price not clearance price. There was no hassle with getting rescaned and money back. They lady did with a smile and while looking another employee helped with what I was looking for. This is one of my favorite stores I could spend half a day browsing. Can't wait to go back. I highly recommend they have everything from Bibles, music , journals to jewelry and everything in between

name: Alicia Brewer
text: I'm very disappointed with my experience. We came from out of town for our friend's baptism and birthday. We wanted to get him his first bible (he's 25) and wanted to get it engraved. We got there about 1.5 hours before they closed. We had found the perfect bible and were very excited! We wanted to get it engraved but the lady at the front said she had turned the machine off for the night. We explained the situation as this we're a special time for our friend but since the machine "takes a long time to heat up" we couldn't get it. We even told her we would wait but she didn't want to help us. I planned to get more things while there, but we just paid for the Bible and left disappointed. Thank you for the experience- usually Lifeway stores are better than this. You've definitely lost a customer.

text: Delicious! They have a ready-to-eat case with single items and a menu to order from in-store. Pine Brook shopping center is a good substitute mall experience, sort of going up and down the sidewalk, and had never been in here.They have three ready-to-go larger arrangements in the refrigerated case. They have balloons and cards, and deliver for a fee. My companion got a chocolate-dipped piece of pineapple in the shape of a star on a stick. They also offer fruit parfaits in a cup @$5, and cones of fruit which are the best deal, and have a binder of other items you can order. The woman answered all of my questions and wasn't in a rush and not phased when chocolate fell on the floor. Fun contest with their photo cardboard cutout.

name: Roland Hayes
text:
READ THE REVIEWS-YOU WILL SEE I'M NOT THE ONLY ONE WITH THIS PROBLEM!
I placed my order on Wednesday, August 15, 2018 for an arrangement for my Brother and Sister-in-law who's daughter had died 25 years ago this week and I just wanted to send them something to let them know I was thinking about them.  I ask the representative when was the soonest they could deliver the arrangement?  She told me they could deliver it around 12 Noon on Thursday, August 16, 2018.  I told her that would be great and to please get it there as close to Noon as possible.  She said they would.  I called Edible Arrangements at 12:30pm to see if my order had been delivered. The lady told me it was on the table being finished.  I told her it was supposed to be delivered at Noon and asked her when would it be delivered.  She told me by 2pm.  Bottom line, they did not get the arrangement delivered until 4:45pm and where they had to deliver it to was less than 3 miles from the Edible Arrangements shop.  I called and spoke to the manager and she didn't care at all about the problem and said there was no way they could have gotten it there by Noon.  I ordered it the day before. They open at 8am and you can't fix, arrange and deliver an arrangement by Noon and it is less than 3 miles from your place of business?  Something is wrong with your Business Plan then.  I called and complained to corporate  and they said they would have the owner call me from the Mobile, Alabama location but, I have not received a call yet.  I spent over $100.00 and the business delivered it when they wanted to not, when I wanted them to.  If I don't hear from the owner this week, I'm sending it to my attorney. I know it's just a $100.00 but, it's about the principle of the matter.  This business did not do what they said they would do and they have not even offered an apology, much less a refund.  Well, I expect a call and if I don't get one, it will most certainly cost them more than$100.00.  I don't want to have to do this but, it's time people are held accountable for their actions and it starts now for Edible Arrangements in Mobile,  Alabama.

name: Phil Jones
text: I have never had any problems with any Edible Arrangements location except this one.  After waiting in line on Valentine's Day for almost TWO hours for an order I had placed online, I finally had to leave and get a different V Day present.  Nobody ever came outside to give updates or give reasons for anything. People who had previously ordered days before were coming out saying their order wasn't even done!  It was so disorganized and confusing, and NOBODY was coming out happy.   I would personally like my money back, but the only thing we got was management sending a letter a week later saying they were "sooooo sorry" (actual quote, which shows how "professional" they are).  They should have had a line for order pick-ups, and then a different line for people last minute ordering. Or they could have at least had someone come out and explain whatever the heck was going on inside the store. Very disappointed and I was definitely not the only one.

name: Bailey Whittington

resp.text: Bailey Whittington, we're so glad everything worked out for you! Would you like us to enter a compliment to the location on your behalf. If so, please e-mail us at orderteam@edible.com. We'd love to share this with that management team!

Called the day before my wife's birthday to get her some strawberries, pineapples, and bananas all covered in chocolate. For whatever reason they thought I said no bananas and add apples. I'm sure it was a misunderstanding of some sort. MAKE SURE YOU DOUBLE CHECK YOUR ORDER WHEN YOU ORDER OVER THE PHONE.
I contacted the store to tell then what happened and the last laughed and said "well the apples and pineapples are really good." That's not the point. My wife loves chocolate covered bananas and she didn't get any of them.
I called back and spoke with a man who said I could come back by and pick up the bananas, thus salvaging later purchases from me.

resp.text: Andrew Conant We’re very sorry we disappointed you. Please email us at orderteam@edible.com with your order details, and we will look into this farther for you.

Retail 199.99
Closeout 59.30

What would you assume? Who does that to customers? Not a great business.. and employees acted as if that’s common sense that the section number of the store would be hand written where a price would normally go.

name: Kitten Kaos
text:
I have taken two classes with Stacy at the Mill over this summer.

The Octopus class was incredibly detailed and amazingly cool. Nothing held back; Stacy is invested in her students having as much success as possible in the process. She was accommodating to my flight schedule and carry-on restrictions and worked with me on the things I could not bring on the plane. The class was fun and I got to meet and make new friends with a great bunch of clay folk. And, I made a crazy octopus bowl to boot!

Later in the summer, I was able to take another class, Slip Trailing, on my way to a work seminar. This was a tremendous compliment to the octopus work, and will have applications in a lot of my other work. It adds a dimension (literally) that is not available through glaze or underglaze. She was detailed enough in the chemistry that I was hooked, but not so much that the class was lost. The demos and slip play go a super long way in understanding the intricasies of the process.

Now to the area. Alabama is just lovely! The hot sticky weather that they were having was perfect for my cold northern blood. The flora in Alabama is completely different to mine, and I enjoyed driving around to take it all in. The Mills are an amazing space dedicated to the arts and I could have spent days wandering the booths. And!! Anyone visiting Stacy who is gluten free or paleo; I found the most delightful bakery and eatery. Their dedicated gluten free facility has some of the best stuff, and that includes BEFORE my diagnosis. Try the jalapeno cheddar scones at Mason Dixon Bakery, you’ll never want to leave.

So seriously, if the opportunity comes to have class with Stacy and S.P.Morgan Studios, take it; you will have no regrets.

name: Betsy
text: I have purchased several pieces from Stacy Morgan and every piece is as beautiful and well crafted as the last. The glazes and her techniques make each piece truly special whether it is functional like a great noodle bowl or decorative. Stacy responds quickly and is very helpful. I will keep ordering more.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Betsy! I appreciate your kind words and your support.

name: Kathryn Somers
text: I have taken 2 workshops from Stacy.  She is a wonderful instructor who is able to communicate and demonstrate effectively to her classes.   She is funny, passionate, curious and caring, thoughtful and a fountain of knowledge.   The facility at Lowe Mill in Huntsville is fantastic and her studio there is an artist's dream - open and full of light.    Her work is fully of whimsy and charm and is always flawless in its execution.   I am delighted to have a piece of her work and it makes me smile whenever I walk by it.

resp.text: Thanks, Kathryn! I hope we get to reconnect soon.

name: Cheryl Krebs
text: An incredibly talented potter with a ♡ of gold. I own a few of Stacy’s pieces and enjoy them even more each day. They are durable and SO FUN! I am also a potter so I have pretty high standards for skill and aesthetics... her pieces exceed the quality of most potters and the aesthetics speak for themselves. If you get a chance to meet Stacy... do it... then when you drink from one of her vessels you can think of her and enjoy the moment even more.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Cheryl. I learned by being a part of our community. <3

text: I'm so picky about pottery, but Stacy's work is incredibly unique, hitting all the notes from moody and dark to bright and whimsical and everywhere in-between. She's always experimenting with new designs and techniques while maintaining top notch quality. I'm proud to own her artwork! We are running out of room on our mug shelf because we can't stop purchasing her mugs.

name: Kiley Salmon
text: I love every piece that I have from here. They are each so unique and beautiful. If you are like me and love the feel of textures on your hands you will love her work. I don't think that I truly ever appreciated the work that goes in to someone making coffee cups and vases but after touching my first cup and following her page I am always in awe of the things that she can make.

resp.text: Thank you! I appreciate the support.

text: Her work is simply mesmerizing, the glaze work is the coolest I've ever seen. I had to get a purple squid mug and it's one of my absolute favorites.  Almost too pretty to use. I've gotten so many compliments on it and considering I've used it at least twice a week since last June, I think it's holding up well for hand made pottery. I look forward to expanding my collection.

Upon arrival, I was amazed to find the item I had purchased (one of her awesome frog mugs) was even more beautiful in person. The design is excellent too, as the handle is sooo comfy in my hand! I give SP Morgan Studio my highest recommendation!

When I can't make it to her studio in person, I keep an eye on her website and jump at the chance to add another piece to my collection.

Not only did I learn all about how to make pieces with her techniques we also quickly became friends. Her easy manner and southern hospitality were endearing and welcoming. We planned a second trip out with the original group we had but were very disappointed to have to reschedule due to Covid-19. It’s been the highlight of my year to return and take more classes with Stacy.

resp.text: Thank you, Laura. I am holding high hopes we get to have our reunion this fall and I am so looking forward to seeing you all again.

name: Elizabeth Stone
text:
POOR-QUALITY PRODUCTS and CUSTOMER SERVICE; take your money somewhere with quality products, that won’t self-destruct three day later, and people who make you feel like they value your business:

I have never publicly reviewed a company for a negative experience, but if this saves someone his/her money, then so be it: I went in to this salon on a Sunday because I was shopping in the area and my go-to nail salon, Royal Day Spa, was closed. I spent, roughly, $65 for a full set (acrylic) and pedicure. THREE DAYS LATER, one of my nails breaks off....then another...and then another. On my other hand, it was visible and evident that two more nails were cracking in the very place where my other three nails popped off (there are more nails broken in the below picture because I, easily and effortlessly, popped the rest off as I left the shop). So, on my first free day, Saturday, I returned and explained my dilemma to the employee, who did my nails, and she directed me to the owner. (Boy, does the owner need a customer-service professional development.)
She immediately begins to fuss about how my nails will not match the original color if I simply repair the three broken nails because they were “old” and that I should get a fill-in. When I explained that I do not need a fill-in as I was just there less than a week ago, she tells me that it’s my fault the nails broke off because they were “too long.” (I do not wear my nails obnoxiously long and they were the same length I typically get at Royal Day Spa, my usual nail salon, which NEVER pop off, even weeks later when I need a major fill-in.) The owner quoted me a price and I, sadly, asked, “There’s a full-price charge for this?” She then began speaking quickly, again, and waving her hands as she was saying, “Yes! Yes!” When I responded, “Wow. No, thanks,” she began motioning me out of the door.
“Disappointed” isn’t the word.

POOR-QUALITY PRODUCTS and CUSTOMER SERVICE.
